dealing with negative people.title: limit your interaction
dealing with negative people.explanation: Do what you have to do and get the job done, but you don't necessarily need to give them access to your energy.

dealing with negative people.title: try empathizing
dealing with negative people.explanation: [start B-roll] You don't have to like someone, but if you try to understand where they're coming [end B-roll] from you'd be surprised with a couple of questions coming from a genuine place how far that can take you in a relationship with someone.

dealing with negative people.title: set clear boundaries
dealing with negative people.explanation: [start B-roll] You have to let them know what's acceptable, what's not acceptable, [end B-roll] and then you have to personally respect your own boundaries. If they wanna live in negativity, that's cool, but you don't have to live there.

leadership.title: you don't need the title to lead
leadership.explanation: You can be a leader without the title. [start B-roll] Leadership is a choice, an action. Not a position. [end B-roll]
leadership.notes: Core insight from influence vs authority script - challenges title dependency

leadership.title: lead by influence, not authority
leadership.explanation: [start B-roll] When you move to influence-based leadership, you develop communication skills in ways you haven't been challenged before. [end B-roll] It's harder, but it builds real trust.
leadership.notes: From 2019 career transition - real leader quote, real growth

leadership.title: trust matters more than title
leadership.explanation: The question isn't about having authority. [start B-roll] It's about earning trust. [end B-roll] Trust is what actually moves people.
leadership.notes: Central theme from influence script - vulnerable honest question

influence vs authority.title: influence requires different skills than authority
influence vs authority.explanation: [start B-roll] Leading by influence means you have to develop your communication skills in ways you haven't been challenged before. [end B-roll] You can't just tell people what to do - you have to bring them along.
influence vs authority.notes: Key insight from PM transition - real challenge faced

influence vs authority.title: your relationship to teams evolves
influence vs authority.explanation: When you shift from authority to influence, [start B-roll] your view on leadership evolves and so does your relationship to the teams. [end B-roll] You become a different kind of leader.
influence vs authority.notes: Personal evolution from 2019 Operations to PM role

dealing with negative people.hook: Negative people. The easiest thing to do is to get rid of negative people when you don't agree with them. But the reality is that's not always an option.
dealing with negative people.notes: Original hook - honest, relatable problem statement

leadership.hook: Years ago, I moved on from a position of leadership to a strategic individual contributor role, and at the time, I kept asking myself this one question: What's more impactful: a title or someone's trust?
leadership.notes: Personal story hook - vulnerable, relatable question that sets up the journey

influence vs authority.hook: Years ago, I moved on from a position of leadership to a strategic individual contributor role, and at the time, I kept asking myself this one question: What's more impactful: a title or someone's trust?
influence vs authority.notes: Sets up influence theme perfectly - real experience, honest question

full_scripts.hook: Negative people. The easiest thing to do is to get rid of negative people when you don't agree with them. But the reality is that's not always an option.
full_scripts.intro: Hi my name is Dorian. I'm a senior project manager for a major airline by day and by night I share content with thousands of people focused on personal growth and development.
full_scripts.transition: [start B-roll] Whether in your community or at work [end B-roll] here are three ways to work with people you don't get along with.

tips.title: limit your interaction
tips.explanation: Do what you have to do and get the job done, but you don't necessarily need to give them access to your energy.

tips.title: try empathizing
tips.explanation: [start B-roll] You don't have to like someone, but if you try to understand where they're coming [end B-roll] from you'd be surprised with a couple of questions coming from a genuine place how far that can take you in a relationship with someone.

tips.title: set clear boundaries
tips.explanation: [start B-roll] You have to let them know what's acceptable, what's not acceptable, [end B-roll] and then you have to personally respect your own boundaries. If they wanna live in negativity, that's cool, but you don't have to live there.

full_scripts.cta: If you found this helpful, follow along and share this with someone who might need it today. Let's grow together.
full_scripts.notes: Original script example - good structure and flow

full_scripts.hook: Years ago, I moved on from a position of leadership to a strategic individual contributor role, and at the time, I kept asking myself this one question: What's more impactful: a title or someone's trust?
full_scripts.intro: Hi, My name is Dorian, I'm a Senior Project manager for a major airline by day, and by night I share content with thousands of people focused on personal growth and development.
story: In 2019, I left a commercial role to return to Operations as a frontline leaderâ€”best decision I made.

A few years later when I became a project manager, one of my leaders notably said, 'You now have to lead by influence, not authority.' That required me to develop my communication skills in ways I hadn't been challenged before.
My view on influence evolved and so did my relationship to our teams. You can be a leader without the title. Leadership is a choice, an action. Not a position.
full_scripts.cta: If you found this helpful, follow along and share this with someone who'll find this useful. Let's grow together.
full_scripts.notes: Personal story format - vulnerable hook, real career journey, powerful insight. Different from tips format - this is pure storytelling. Shows evolution from 2019 to now.
key_insights: Lead by influence not authority quote
Leadership is a choice not a position

_instructions.how_to_add_tips: Add new tips under the 'tips' section with the topic as the key. Each tip should have: title, explanation, b_roll (true/false), and optional notes.
_instructions.how_to_add_hooks: Add new hooks under the 'hooks' section with the topic as the key. Each hook should have: hook text and optional notes about why it works.
_instructions.how_to_add_scripts: Add complete scripts under 'full_scripts'. Include: topic, hook, intro, transition, tips array, cta, notes, and optional performance metrics.
_instructions.priority: The generator will PRIORITIZE your examples over built-in content. Your voice, your style, your proven content comes first.
_instructions.notes_field: Use 'notes' to remind yourself why this content works - high engagement, clarity, relatability, etc.
